alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 3:53AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT...THE CITY OF NORFOLK...THE CITY OF CHESAPEAKE...THE CITY OF PORTSMOUTH...THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF SUFFOLK AND THE CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH THROUGH 430 AM EST... At 352 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Norfolk International to Norfolk State University to Deep Creek to 7 miles northeast of Corapeake. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Virginia Beach, Great Bridge, Regent University, Deep Creek, Kempsville, Virginia Wesleyan University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Fentress, and Norfolk International around 400 AM EST. Princess Anne around 410 AM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include South Norfolk, Rudee Heights, Portlock, Mount Pleasant, Princess Anne Plaza, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Herberts Corner, Oceana NAS, and Macons Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach
